page.title: 04PUBLIC TRANSPORT RAVENGLASS
page.content: The British Rail Barrow/Carlisle line runs through Ravenglass,which has an unmanned station,and crosses the Mite and Irt estuaries by viaduct.There are 6 trains a day each way,except on Sunday, connecting with Barrow-in- Furness and Carnforth on the mainline to the South and Whitehaven and Carlisle to the North.During the summer and on Saturdays there are extra trains.Excursion trains pulled by steam engines are run to Ravenglass to connect with the Ravenglass and Eskdale narrow-gauge railway from all over Britain. The bus-service was withdrawn in early 1985.Now only a schoolbus to Millom leaves at 8 am and returns at 4.30pm during schoolterm. The R&E Railway runs a service 7mls up Eskdale to Boot.
